trans-unit.source: System procedures for storing jar files in a database

seg-source.mrk: System procedures for storing jar files in a database

target.mrk: System procedures for storing jar files in a database

trans-unit.source: <codeph>SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR</codeph>, <codeph>SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR</codeph>, and <codeph>SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR</codeph> are a set of procedures in the SQLJ schema that allow you to store jar files in a database.

seg-source.mrk: <codeph>SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR</codeph>, <codeph>SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR</codeph>, and <codeph>SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR</codeph> are a set of procedures in the SQLJ schema that allow you to store jar files in a database.

target.mrk: <codeph>SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR</codeph>, <codeph>SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR</codeph>, and <codeph>SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR</codeph> are a set of procedures in the SQLJ schema that allow you to store jar files in a database.

trans-unit.source: Your jar file has two names:

seg-source.mrk: Your jar file has two names:

target.mrk: Your jar file has two names:

trans-unit.source: A physical name (the name you gave it when you created it)

seg-source.mrk: A physical name (the name you gave it when you created it)

target.mrk: A physical name (the name you gave it when you created it)

trans-unit.source: A name (the identifier you give it when you load it into a particular schema). The name, an SQL92Identifier, can be delimited and must be unique within a schema.

seg-source.mrk: A name (the identifier you give it when you load it into a particular schema).
The name, an SQL92Identifier, can be delimited and must be unique within a schema.

target.mrk: A name (the identifier you give it when you load it into a particular schema).
The name, an SQL92Identifier, can be delimited and must be unique within a schema.

trans-unit.source: A single schema can store more than one jar file.

seg-source.mrk: A single schema can store more than one jar file.

target.mrk: A single schema can store more than one jar file.

trans-unit.source: For more information on when and how to use these procedures, see "Loading classes from a database" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information on when and how to use these procedures, see "Loading classes from a database" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information on when and how to use these procedures, see "Loading classes from a database" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
